reporter_caption.center: GOLD CREEK MINING CO. v. KROEHNKE, 103 Mont. 618 (1936)

caption.center: GOLD CREEK MINING CO., APPELLANT, v. DAISY B. KROEHNKE, RESPONDENT.

posture.italic: Appeal from District Court, Silver Bow County, in the Second
Judicial District; Geo. W. Padbury, Jr., a Judge of the First

opinion.opinion_text: The parties herein having filed their stipulation for dismissal of the appeal herein, and the controversy having been fully settled, it is ordered that the appeal be dismissed on the merits, each party paying its or her costs of appeal.
opinion.attorneys:
Mr. S.P. Wilson and Mr. William Meyer, for Appellant.
Mr. H.L. Maury and Mr. A.G. Shone, for Respondent.Page 619
